ygData.subject: Trivia
ygData.msgSnippet: Ok, I am stumped on a few things. Why is a slime with only level 40 experience with everything else being 40 have more health power than a level 300 archer

From: "dph of rules " <dph_of_rules@...>

Ok, I am stumped on a few things.

Why is a slime with only level 40 experience with everything else 
being 40 have more health power than a level 300 archer with 
everything else being 300?  I have decided that true torture would be 
a level with 4 level 100 slime.

Why do when slime multiply, the new slime become a permanen part of 
your team but when your cleric raises undead, they do not become a 
permanent part of your team?  If I could keep them, I would transfer 
all my undead unto a team by themselves.

Is there any way to control what kind of image an archmage summons?  
This may sound dumb, but how logically can a cleric raise a ghost or 
skeleton from a dead image?

Can anyone tell me what scenario numbers have been taken?  I was 
thinking about downloading all the user-created levels and if I did 
not see scenarios like I wanted, creating my own scenarios.  I would 
call my saga "The Extreme Challenges".
